verses.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath: But grievous words stir up anger.
The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: But the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
The eyes of the \sc Lord\sc* \add are\add* in every place, Beholding the evil and the good.
A wholesome tongue \add is\add* a tree of life: But perverseness therein \add is\add* a breach in the spirit.
A fool despiseth his fatherâ€™s instruction: But he that regardeth reproof is prudent.
\add In\add* the house of the righteous \add is\add* much treasure: But in the revenues of the wicked \add is\add* trouble.
The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: But the heart of the foolish \add doeth\add* not so.
The sacrifice of the wicked \add is\add* an abomination to the \sc Lord\sc*: But the prayer of the upright \add is\add* his delight.
The way of the wicked \add is\add* an abomination unto the \sc Lord\sc*: But he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
Correction \add is\add* grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: \add And\add* he that hateth reproof shall die.
Hell and destruction \add are\add* before the \sc Lord\sc*: How much more then the hearts of the children of men?
A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: Neither will he go unto the wise.
A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: But by sorrow of the heart the spirit \add is\add* broken.
The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: But the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
All the days of the afflicted \add are\add* evil: But \add he that is\add* of a merry heart \add hath\add* a continual feast.
Better \add is\add* little with the fear of the \sc Lord\sc* Than great treasure and trouble therewith.
Better \add is\add* a dinner of herbs where love is, Than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
A wrathful man stirreth up strife: But \add he that is\add* slow to anger appeaseth strife.
The way of the slothful \add man is\add* as a hedge of thorns: But the way of the righteous \add is\add* made plain.
A wise son maketh a glad father: But a foolish man despiseth his mother.
Folly \add is\add* joy to \add him that is\add* destitute of wisdom: But a man of understanding walketh uprightly.
Without counsel purposes \add are\add* disappointed: But in the multitude of counsellers \add they\add* are established.
A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: And a word \add spoken\add* in due season, how good \add is it!\add*
The way of life \add is\add* above to the wise, That \add he\add* may depart from hell beneath.
The \sc Lord\sc* will destroy the house of the proud: But he will establish the border of the widow.
The thoughts of the wicked \add are\add* an abomination to the \sc Lord\sc*: But \add the words of\add* the pure \add are\add* pleasant words.
He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; But he that hateth gifts shall live.
The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: But the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil \add things\add*.
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* far from the wicked: But he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: \add And\add* a good report maketh the bones fat.
The ear that heareth the reproof of life Abideth among the wise.
He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: But he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.
The fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* the instruction of wisdom; And before honour \add is\add* humility.
